title: The "Mayura Bandham" Diamond Vaddanam: A Timeless Masterpiece
materials: Crafted with 159.400 grams of high-purity gold. Adorned with 16.18 carats (2295 pieces) of brilliant-cut diamonds
and 5.11 carats of Emeralds (2 pieces). Features a meticulous Hyderabadi polish
ensuring a radiant and enduring shine.
features: This Vaddanam showcases a stunning peacock (Mayura) design, a symbol of grace and beauty in South Indian culture. Intricately designed peacocks are set among floral motifs, all meticulously encrusted with diamonds. The center features a square-cut emerald, complemented by a pear-shaped emerald drop. The piece employs a pave setting for maximum diamond brilliance and features an antique finish to enhance the traditional aesthetic.
colors: The color palette features the warm glow of gold
the sparkling brilliance of white diamonds
and the fiery red of rubies – a traditionally auspicious combination.
occasions: and other grand celebrations. Its timeless elegance also makes it a treasured heirloom piece for any special occasion.
description: This Vaddanam is more than just jewelry; it's an investment in a piece of South Indian heritage. The combination of high-quality materials, expert craftsmanship, and traditional design makes it a truly exceptional piece. The peacock motif symbolizes beauty, prosperity, and good luck, making it a meaningful and auspicious addition to any jewelry collection. The durable construction and timeless design ensure it can be treasured for generations.
